Consideration should be given to ensuring that the facility can be easily accessible by a wide range of users. 17.26 Part 4 encourages new development to consider adaptable and flexible design, considering future-proofing new development and pursuing a more sustainable future for the borough by minimising the need for intensive redevelopment if a change of use were to be required in the future to better accommodate the needs of the community. Development proposals should demonstrate that they have factored in adaptability principles in the design process, examples of which include: z clear structural spans; allowing for wider, more open and flexible interior spaces; z non-load-bearing and flexible interior partitions, which help spatial programs be adapted over time with minimal need to alter the structure of the building, or during the use of the facility as it caters to different needs; and
